alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 12:10PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures continue to melt snowpack. An active and wet weather pattern today through the midweek could increase water levels and flows rapidly. For the Marys River...including Deeth, Charleston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach. Some rural roads near the river begin to flood. Very minor flooding begins in Winnemucca with storm drain backups, and the lowest parts of town begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM PDT Tuesday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 9.7 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 07/03/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
